intro: Clypea acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed clypea, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
